en:
h1(Welcome to OBLIT Protocol) h3(Obliterate Latency. Zero-Dependency. Binary-First. Production-Ready.) ![info](OBLIT replaces bloated HTTP/JSON traffic with a lean, **3-byte header** binary stream, achieving over **55% bandwidth savings**. Built for developers who demand performance, simplicity, and reliability in their network applications.)!++ !(line) h2(ğŸ¯ What Problem Does OBLIT Solve?) Modern web protocols are **text-based** and carry hundreds of bytes of unnecessary metadata. This creates significant overhead for high-frequency applications like real-time games, chat systems, and IoT devices.
ProtocolOverhead Per MessageData FormatBest ForBandwidth Efficiency
HTTP/1.1~800 BytesText (JSON/XML)Web Pages, REST APIsâŒ Very Low
WebSocket~2-14 BytesText/BinaryReal-time Web Appsâš ï¸ Moderate
TCP Raw0 Bytes (custom)BinaryCustom Protocolsâœ… High (no structure)
ğŸ¯ OBLIT3 BytesBinary FirstHigh-Performance Appsâœ…âœ… Excellent
h3(Real-World Impact) Consider a multiplayer game sending player positions 60 times per second:
Scenario: 100 players, 30 ticks/sec, position updates

JSON Approach:
{ "id": 42, "x": 1234, "y": 5678 } = 28 bytes

OBLIT Binary Approach:
[2B ID] [2B X] [2B Y] = 6 bytes

Savings: 78% smaller per message!

Hourly Impact: JSON: ~200 MB | OBLIT: ~44 MB = 156 MB saved per hour!
!(line) h2(âœ¨ Core Features)

ğŸš« Zero Dependencies

No node_modules bloat. Pure Node.js implementation. Minimal attack surface, maximum security.

âš¡ Blazing Fast

Operates on raw TCP sockets with zero-copy parsing. Handles tens of thousands of messages per second.

ğŸ“¦ Lightweight

Less than 2kB minzipped. Perfect for embedded systems, IoT devices, and edge computing.

ğŸ›¡ï¸ Crash-Free

Resilient architecture handles errors gracefully. Malformed packets don't crash your server.

ğŸ”§ Stream Reassembly

Automatic TCP fragmentation handling. Complete packets guaranteed, no manual buffer management.

ğŸ§  Auto-Type Detection

Intelligent payload detection. Send Buffers, Strings, or Objects seamlessly.

!(line) h2(ğŸš€ Quick Start) Get up and running in less than 60 seconds: ![code](// 1. Install OBLIT npm install oblit // 2. Create a server const { Server } = require('oblit'); const app = new Server({ port: 8080 }); // 3. Handle messages app.on('data', (message, socket) => { console.log('Received:', message); // Broadcast to all connected clients app.bc(`Echo: ${message}`); }); // 4. Start the server app.st(() => { console.log('âœ… Server ready on port 8080!'); });)!++// h3(What Just Happened?)
Step 1: We create a Server instance bound to port 8080
Step 2: We listen for incoming 'data' events (packets from clients)
Step 3: When data arrives, we log it and broadcast to all clients
Step 4: We start the server with st() (start method)
!(line) h2(ğŸ“Š Performance Benchmarks) OBLIT doesn't just claim to be fastâ€”it proves it. Our benchmark suite shows consistent performance improvements:
MetricStandard JSONOBLIT ProtocolImprovement
Traffic Volume1318 KB585 KBğŸ“‰ 55% Reduction
Average Packet Size27 Bytes12 Bytesâš¡ 2x Smaller
Header Overhead~800 Bytes (HTTP)3 BytesğŸš€ 99.6% Less
Dependency CountMany0âœ… Zero
![tip](Want to see interactive benchmarks? Check out the **âš¡ Interactive Benchmarks** section in the sidebar! You can compare different versions and see real-time performance data.)!++ !(line) h2(ğŸ“ Learning Path) New to OBLIT? Follow this recommended learning path:
  1. Installation Guide - Get OBLIT set up in your project
  2. Protocol Anatomy - Understand the binary packet structure
  3. Server API - Learn how to build servers
  4. Client API - Learn how to connect clients
  5. Chat App Tutorial - Build your first real application
  6. Game Server Tutorial - Master binary data optimization
![info](All tutorials include complete, copy-paste-ready code examples. You can follow along and have a working application in minutes.)!++ !(line) h2(ğŸ’¡ Why Choose OBLIT?)
ğŸ¯ Perfect For:
  • Real-time multiplayer games
  • High-frequency trading systems
  • IoT device communication
  • Chat and messaging applications
  • Live streaming data pipelines
  • Any application where bandwidth and latency matter
âš ï¸ Not Ideal For:
  • Standard REST APIs (use HTTP instead)
  • Simple request-response patterns (HTTP is simpler)
  • Browser-to-server communication (use WebSocket)
!(line) h2(ğŸ”— Next Steps) Ready to start? Head over to the **[Installation Guide](#!/install)** to get OBLIT set up in your project! Or dive deeper into how OBLIT works by reading about the **[Protocol Anatomy](#!/protocol)**. ![tip](Pro Tip: Bookmark this documentation site! It's designed to be your complete reference guide for building high-performance applications with OBLIT.)!++ !(line)
ğŸ“ Important Note:
It is not recommended to send OBLIT data to endpoints that do not use the OBLIT protocol. OBLIT requires both client and server to use the protocol for proper data transmission and optimal bandwidth savings. If either endpoint doesn't support OBLIT, the data cannot be properly unpacked and interpreted.
